```{r}
# Install pacman if not already installed
if (!requireNamespace("pacman", quietly = TRUE)) {
  install.packages("pacman")
}

# Load required packages (install if missing)
pacman::p_load(
  tidyverse,
  ggwordcloud # Word cloud plotting
)

```


```{r}
# Load dataset (not used in this viz, but retained for future exploration)
all_recipes <- readr::read_csv(
  'https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/main/data/2025/2025-09-16/all_recipes.csv'
)

cuisines <- readr::read_csv(
  'https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/main/data/2025/2025-09-16/cuisines.csv'
)

```

```{r}
# Define ingredients
weird_ingredients <- c(
  "Worcestershire sauce",
  "Truffle oil",
  "Oyster sauce",
  "Hoisin sauce",
  "Seaweed",
  "Spirulina",
  "White wine",
  "Whole beef tongue",
  "Sauerkraut"
)
```


```{r}
# Create custom theme
custom_theme <- theme(
  text = element_text(family = "verdana"), # Global font
  plot.margin = margin(10, 10, 10, 10),
  plot.background = element_rect(fill = "ivory", color = NA),
  panel.background = element_rect(fill = "ivory", color = NA),
  plot.title = element_text(
    size = 18,
    face = "bold",
    hjust = 0.5,
    margin = margin(t = 30, b = 10)
  ),
  plot.subtitle = element_text(
    size = 16,
    hjust = 0.5
  ),
  plot.caption = element_text(
    size = 14,
    hjust = 0.5,
    margin = margin(t = 10, b = 25)
  )
)
```


```{r}
word_df <- data.frame(word = weird_ingredients) %>%
  mutate(
    size = if_else(word == "Worcestershire sauce", 15, 13),
    color = if_else(
      word == "Worcestershire sauce",
      "royalblue4",
      "lightsteelblue3"
    )
  )
```


```{r}
# Generate word cloud plot
ggplot(word_df, aes(label = word, size = size, color = color)) +
  geom_text_wordcloud(shape = "circle") +
  scale_size_identity() +
  scale_color_identity() +
  labs(
    title = "Ingredients That Make Me Wanna Run",
    subtitle = "Me, mid-recipe, realizing I need one of these.",
    caption = "Inspired by: all.recipes.com | Visualization: Darakhshan Nehal"
  ) +
  custom_theme

```

```{r}
# Save plot
ggsave(
  filename = "ingredients.png",
  width = 9,
  height = 7,
  dpi = 300,
  bg = "ivory"
)

```
